div.ab:
ثبّت ثبت عندي جميع ما نص وشرح فيه وكتب محمّد
بن عبيد اللّه بن حفص بخطّه في شهر رمضان ســنة إحدى
واربعين وأربع مائـپة
بسم اللّه الرّحــمن الرّحيم وصلّى اللّه على سيّدنا محمّد رسوله وسلّمه بالسّلام
هذا ما اشترى قلته بن كيل القــزّاز السّاكن مدينة الأشمونين الّتي من أرض صعيد مصر من والده كيل بن جــريج
القزّاز السّاكن بهذه المدينة المذكورة اشترى منه بــمــاله لنفــسه الّذي أنعم اللّه عز وجل عليه به حميع ما اعــلمه
أنّه له وبملكه وفي يده ملكا صحيحا وحقّا واجبا وهو جميع المنزل الّذي بهذه المدينة المذكورة في الجانب
البحريّ منها على الكوم المطلّ على الكنيسيّة المعروفة بالبرتانــس ويحيط بهذا المنزل المبيّع بأسره وكماله
ويجمعه ويشتمل عليه حدود أربعة فالحدّ القبليّ منه ينتهي إلى الزّقاق الــنّافذ من طرفيه إلي طرق شتّى وفيه يشــرع
بابه الأوّل كان الحدّ البحريّ منه ينتهي إلى بئر تعرف بالصّعيدي وإلى بو طوربن مقابر المُسلمين والحد
الشّرقيّ منه ينتهي إلى عرصة لبقطر البنّا وإلى دار منصــور الرّسول كان وإلى منزل يُعرف يسكبىبسكنى
غطارف بن مفلح كان والحدّ الغربيّ منه ينتهي إلى منزل جــعفر بن سياع الإبشادي فاشترى منه جميع هذا
المنزل المحدود الموصوف في هذا الكتاب بحــدّه وحدوده وأرضه وسمائه وبنائه وفنائه وكل قليل وكثير
هو له داخل فيه وكلّ قليل وكثير هو له خارج منه وما هو معــروف له ومنسوب إليه ظاهره وباطنه وعامره وغامره
صفقة واحدة بثمن مبلغه دنانير مســتنصريّة وازنة جياد العيون شرى صحيحا وبيعا
نافذا ماضيا لا شرط فيه ولا خيار ولا استثنى ولا إقالة ولا إعادة ولا رجعة ولا مثنويّة لا لردّه
ولا لنفسه لا لأجل ولا لأبد ولا هو على سبيل رهن ولا هبة ولا تلجئة ودفع المشتري
المذكور في هذا الكتاب إلى البائع المذكور فيه جميع هذا الثّمن المذكور فقبضه منه لنفسه نقدا
في يده تامّا وافيا وأبرأه من ذلك ومن نقــده ووزنه ومن اليمين عليه أو على شي منه براة
قبض له واستيفا بجميعه من كلّ قول وحجّة ويمين على جميع الوجوه والأسباب كلّها وسلّم البايع إلى ولده
قلته بن كيل جميع ما وقع وقع عليه هذا البيع المذكور وتســلّمه منه وحازه لنفسه وصار في يده
وملكه ومالا من ماله يتحكّم فيه بحكم الملّاك في أملاكهم وذلك بعد معرفتهما لما تبايعا
عليه وتقليب منهما بجميعه وإنفاذ ونفاذ منهما له فتبايعا ذلك بينهما عن تراضيهما علــى حكم بيع الإسلام

All that is specially mentioned and explained herein has been proved in my presence and Muḥa[mmad]
b. ʿUbaidallâh b. Ḥafṣ has written (it) in his (own) handwriting in the month of Ramaḍân of the ye[ar]
four hundre[d] and forty[one].
[In the name of God, the Compassio]nate, the Merciful. May the blessing of God be upon our Lord Muḥammad, His Messenger, and may He give him peace.
[This is what Qolte b. Chael, the silk]-mercer, residing in the town of al-Ušmûnain, which belongs to the territory of upper Egypt, has bought from his father Chael b. Ǧu[raiǧ],
[the silk-mercer, residing in this (above) mentioned town]: he has bought from him with [his own mo]ney, which God - He is mighty and sublime - has bestowed upon him as a favour, all that he (the seller) informed him
[that it was belonging to him and in his possession and in his hand(s) as a legal possession, and a declared right, namely the whole of the dwelling house], that stands to the north side of the (above) mentioned town,
[on the hill looking down upon the little church known as al-Bartâno]s (of the Virgin). Now four boundaries enclose,
[encompass and surround this dwelling house], which is sold entirely [completely: the southern boundary thereof extends to the lane] forming from both sides the thoroughfare to diverse roads, with which
[its former first door communicates; and the northern boundary thereof extends to a well known as a]ṣ-Ṣaʿîdî and to Bû Ṭûrbon, the Muslim cemetery; and the eas-
[tern boundary thereof extends to the open area, belonging to Boqṭor, the builder, and to the former house of Man]ṣûr, the messenger, and to the dwelling house known as the former habitation
[of Ġaṭârif b. Mufliḥ; and the western boundary thereof extends to the dwellinghouse of Ǧa]ʿfar b. Sibâʿ, originating from Ibšâda. So he has bought from him the whole of this
[dwelling house defined and described in this act, to its li]mit and its boundaries, and its land and its sky, and its building(s) and its fore-court and all of little and much
[connected with it within and all of little and much connected with it without, and what is known as ap]pertaining and relating to it, (be it) outside or inside, inhabited or empty,
[in one striking (of hands) for a price which amounts to ...... dînârs] in full weight, good gold-coins of [al-Mu]stanṣir, in form of a valid purchase and an effectual
[(and fully) completed sale, in which is no condition and no option (of return)] and no reservation and no rescission (by mutual consent) and no possibility of recurrence and no proviso of the right of reversal and no reserving (of the right) either to return it
[or to annul it, either temporarily or for good, and] it is not in the way of a pledge nor as a gift nor as an exclusive bequest. And the buyer
[mentioned in this act has paid to the seller mentioned] herein the whole of this (above) mentioned price; so he (the seller) has received it from him for himself as a cash payment (paid)
[into his hand(s) fully and entirely, and he has released him from it and from its ready mon]ey and its weight and from the oath with regard to it or any portion thereof, by means of a receipt
[(acknowledging that he has) received for him(self) fully and entirely the whole of it, which releases him from any affirmation or proof or oath for any cau]ses or reasons whatever; and the seller has handed over to [his] son,
[Qolte b. Chael, all in respect to which the (above) mentioned sale was effected, and he (the buyer) has taken] it over from him and acquired possession of it for himself and it has passed into his hand(s)
[and possession and has become his own property, he (the buyer) having free disposition of it according to the free disposition of proprietors] over their property, and this after their having been aware of what they both have sold and bought (respectively),
[and their having examined all of it and their having effected it (the transaction). So they both have bargained] together to [their mutual] satis[faction accor]ding to the rule of Islamic law of sale.
